title: When will Riot actually nerf the powerful junglers instead of all the junglers?
body:
Because this is getting old.
Smite just got a range nerf(arguably) for absolutely no reason, and this puts the hyper mobile junglers on top, who are, ironically, the ones that are doing well in this meta.
Why not just nerf these mobile junglers already instead of the whole jungle? Or even better, buff the immobile ones!

replies.body: Rich get richer, poor get poorer. It's Riot's balance program.
Trickle-down balancing.

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Gx3f9z7B,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-02-14T07:25:58.614+0000)
>
> Trickle-down balancing.

"I believe that balancing institutions are more dangerous to our game than angry children. Already they have raised up an over powered aristocracy of champions that has set the player base at defiance. The issuing power (of balance) should be taken away from Riot and restored to the people to whom it properly belongs." -- Thomas Jefferson, U.S. President.

Thomas Jefferson: "Taxes OP! Too expensive to bui first item on this terribad gold stream! Brito, plz nerf!"

Brito: "You are right, so we will be buffing the cost and taxes of tea, that way the rich pay more!"

Thomas Jefferson: "Brito y u do dis? Now everyone pais moar! Now I can't even afford boots cause pots are too expensive!"

Brito: "lol, git gud scrub."

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Gx3f9z7B,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-02-14T07:25:58.614+0000)
>
> Trickle-down balancing.

Much like with trickle down economics, the only thing that trickles down is piss.
Sounds like you have a trickle down eduction.  Sadly, not much trickled.

Jungling was actually feeling really, really good once the double smite system was implemented.

Then riot increased the machete cost.

Now riot does this.
Nerfing them won't make the others get played. The other junglers need buffs right now before they can start seeing more play.

I fully agree. It's just that they're afraid of knowledge champs that can't make LC$ big plays(Ryze) come back. It would be great to buff champs like Nocturne or Sejuani(for example, there are far more), who need that tiny push to become competitively viable.

+1

Just made a thread on how desperately the other junglers need buffs. I've been seeing some Sejuani in ranked, but they all have a VERY slow start due to the increased jg difficulty.

It's frustrating that champions like Sejuani can't really gank early game because if you farm well, you will be low health and, therefore, unable to gank without dying and, if you keep your HP to gank, you will get no gold since you have not farmed.

The worst part is that Sejuani should supposedly farm better than Lee Sin or Rek'Sai.

Here's the thing, Sejuani doesn't need buffs.

She's at a fairly solid "baseline" for jungle balance. 

The only reason she's weak is that compared to the top 3 super OP junglers (Lee, Vi, J4), she's comparatively weak, as are *all* the other junglers. Buffs to Sejuani would put her at a similar "super OP" tier as those top 3. A lot of junglers need buffs and those top 3 need nerfs, but Sejuani should get neither (for now, at least). She's in a good spot if there aren't those 3 outshining her (as they do everyone).

Nocturne is the same way (except without the ability to completely turn a teamfight when he shows up usually, which Sejuani *does* have)
It doesn't have to be one or the other though. There needs to be a middle ground between buffing and nerfing.

I agree they need to buff the other junglers in a way that adds *counterplay * to the currently strong junglers. Nerfing strong champs sometimes just leads to an opening for other champs and removes them from the game. I don't see riot's idea of diversity anywhere this season.

Is this about the Smite Changes?

I mean, realistically speaking, farming Junglers are almost completely unaffected, like many tank junglers and those hit a bit too hard by how strong the Jungle is now, whereas {{champion:59}} early gankers {{champion:64}} are hurt the most due to the range decrease.

....HOW?
This is a nerf to all the junglers with no instant mobility.
Champions like Rammus and Udyr can no longer smite when they're speeding up.
Meanwhile J4 and Lee can still Q-smite. This is a nerf to all the junglers, but especially to the ones that have no insta gapclose.
These 2 that you listed were far from the ones that were hurt the most.

The nerf hurt all the "highly mobile engage" junglers, the problem is champions like Vi, Lee, and J4 who have multiple mobility moves are almost completely unaffected by it, since they're just going to use their "less important" mobility skill to get into smite range before using their "more important" mobility skill.

Meanwhile, champions like Nautilus and Amumu, who MUST land that 1 skillshot to gank, are completely fucked over.

It's a nerf to ALL junglers, rather than the ***3 CHAMPIONS WHO ACTUALLY NEED NERFS***, which is I guess how Riot does jungle changes. Whatever it takes to keep those guys at the top after all.

Granted, and Vi players will hate me for this, Vi is *never* going to be balanced as long as her Ultimate functions as it does, because the amount of power that ult has in her kit means the rest of her kit would have to be trash for it to be *actually* balanced. 

At least in J4 and Lee Sin's cases, they can bring their "overall" power down without wrecking the champion, but Vi's ultimate (while a cool concept) doesn't work in it's current iteration as a "balanced" skill without making the rest of Vi garbage.

It doesn't have much effect on junglers who don't use chilling smite.

With that said chilling smite is still the most universally useful smite.

Agreed, but as long as Chilling smite is as-close-as-you-can-get-to-being-a-required-choice, it's still a terrible nerf choice.

Taking chilling smite may not be *required* as a gank-focused jungler, but as long as Riot keeps giving lanes vision out the wazoo and forcefully keeping jungler players at low gold, health, and levels, they're basically "bullying" gank-junglers into taking Chilling smite or suffering extremely reduced effectiveness.

Since unless they're just plain oblivious, laners almost always have the *potential* to know the jungler is coming to gank via the massive influx of vision through free wards, a refreshing ward support item, and the scuttle crabs, and not to mention pink wards essentially being a guranteed "get out of gank free" card when used consistently... Using just a basic champion kit to gank without the assistance of chilling smite essentially relies almost entirely on the failures of the enemy getting ganked, rather than the skill of the champion doing the ganking.

> [{quoted}](name=TehNACHO,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Gx3f9z7B,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-14T01:11:01.755+0000)
>
> Is this about the Smite Changes?
> 
> I mean, realistically speaking, farming Junglers are almost completely unaffected, like many tank junglers and those hit a bit too hard by how strong the Jungle is now, whereas {{champion:59}} early gankers {{champion:64}} are hurt the most due to the range decrease.

I do not agree with this. It's actually the other way around. Think about it for a moment.

J4 and Lee Sin come to your lane. The smite range is now reduced. They still perform their gap closing skill (J4 does not even need to hit you and Lee can just W a ward if he miss his Q). They easily get in range of smite, smite you and proceed to have you burn flash or even kill you.

Now imagine Shyvanna or Udyr ganking. They lack instant gap closer and must now cover additionnal distance to smite champions to get the much needed slow to actually put some damage on the laner. You are now forcing these junglers to afk farm even more, and that's not always the good option.

Who do you think is the most affected by these changes? It's the junglers lacking instant gap closer, like always. This won't fix the problem with J4 and Lee Sin, it will only make many other junglers who are already struggling even worse (again).

Yes and no. Champs like Voli, Udyr, ect... with no gap closer and just speed boosts HAVE to have Chilling Smite to get into range to gank. It doesn't hurt Lee Sin (for example) nearly as much as the ones I brought up. So over all it hurts MORE junglers than they say, and it hurts the high mobility champions the least of them.
Riot needs to roll back the shitty jungle changes.

I'm pleading with you, gentlemen. Don't take away my Skarner, DIana, Nocturne, Kayle, or Evelynn.

At first I thought the whole "it's so we see LCS big plays" thing was just nonsense, but when you see bizarre and utterly senseless possible changes like this...How could you even consider it? Why are we narrowing down the list of viable junglers more and more, with the exact opposite sentiment, that this won't be the case for much longer, being said to us?

Even if it's for LCS, wouldn't it make a healthier, longer-lasting community to see some plays with someone...different? Wouldn't that renew interest in the game? No one likes seeing the same damned thing over and over with the same champs. And if a player's truly any good, they should be able to prove it by, you know, adjusting accordingly to the proper balance changes.

Darwin, man. Those who adapt to their environment survive, not the ones who are simply the strongest in the current environment.

Why is Riot's philosophy of balance "nerf nerf nerf nerf nerf" in all classes EXCEPT junglers.

Why is Lee Sin the exception? If he were a top laner they'd nerf him into the ground, leave him unplayable and unviable for 6 months, then buff him up slowly over 3-4 patches until he's playable again.


This philosophy is stupid by the way....


But why is Lee SIn the exception?

The problems wouldn't persist if they nerfed the cooldowns/tankiness/damage on Lee, Vi and J4. That's all that would be necessary. The champs would easily still be viable, but they'd have to risk more which would be healthy for everyone. 

The Smite changes aren't necessary. At all.

The smite changes help against ppl taking chilling smite.  Right now the main abuse cases are the strong "meta" junglers.  This indirectly affects the non top tier ones, but to me, their ability to perform SHOULDN'T hinge on one a summoner spell.

> their ability to perform SHOULDN'T hinge on one a summoner spell.

The fact that junglers are balanced around having an specific summoner spell invalids the whole point. I always thought they should make smite a jungler item active and keep it to clean jungle, so you can play, for example, exhaust/flash on Sejuani and keep your smite to farm.

> [{quoted}](name=ShinobuElveszett,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Gx3f9z7B,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-02-14T09:01:00.682+0000)
>
> The fact that junglers are balanced around having an specific summoner spell invalids the whole point. I always thought they should make smite a jungler item active and keep it to clean jungle, so you can play, for example, exhaust/flash on Sejuani and keep your smite to farm.

Smite flat out shouldn't exist period.

You could argue summoner spells shouldn't exist period.  Everyone brings flash, to the point where it's expected on everyone.  Ignite is an extra damage skill so people are balanced around it.  Heal invalidates fights.  Clarity gives people an easier laning phase.

> [{quoted}](name=NoMonku,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Gx3f9z7B,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-02-14T04:34:54.961+0000)

The only problem with calling Vi/Lee/J4 meta junglers is that they aren't meta junglers. They've been good at Jungling since S3. Out of those three, you could only argue that J4 is a meta jungler because he only reached the top of the pyramid this preseason after every other jungler was nerfed. Meta junglers would be champs that take especially good advantage of a certain meta...these three champs have taken advantage of every meta for the same reasons every time.

nerfing powerful only replaces powerful
how long until you casuals realize that?

That may be true but nerfing an item nerfs every single champion that uses that. They have nerfed the shitty junglers with this nerf along with the best. It is just going to restrict the jungle pool even more.
Because you do not nerf Lee or you get fired.
Ultra mobile champions are not top in the jungle. Ultra mobile champions are top in the jungle, in top, in mid, in bot and even in baron.

I seriously dont get why is it so hard just to buff some champs all i see in every lcs game oh j4, lee, vi, rek, and maybe a fiddle im glad with fiddle showing.
But come on wheres the love for other junglers all i see is the 5 junglers that are used in every lcs game i just want more variety is that too much too ask

Answer? The day that Lee stops making LC$BIGPLAYS - never.

Because seriously. Get a team of chimpanzees, they'll do better job than Riot's balance team.

"Problem is jungles getting first blood, so we are increasing the jungle item cost to compensate". Then suddenly, a wild Lee appears while you are clearing one more camp at 30% HP since you need more gold than earlier and first bloods you. Solved problem, obviously.

"Chilling smite's range for banks is too big". Lee, Jarvan and Vi won't be affected even if you make it melee range. Ones who suffer are Shyvanna, Sion, Voli, etc.

Why is lee sin able to keep most all his health in jungle and still and an early game carry. Every game I play, there are lee sin jungles invading for easy lvl 2 kills against the opposing jungler. There is no danger for them, and then they gank constantly because the jungle doesn't hurt them. If I die to a lee sin, its not because I was "outplayed" its because my team failed to pick lee sin first".

Well they did say they wanted to change the jungle to what it is because they wanted to be able to alter the things in the jungle to deal with certain champions instead of just nerfing those champions specifically. Hasn't worked so far.

That's what they are doing though, nerfing chilling smite (technically it also nerfs challenging, but not as much because it's intended for use on an enemy that fights back rather than one that runs away) is supposed to be a nerf to gank-heavy junglers.

The problem is the meta that demands that junglers that aren't good at ganking must do it all the time anyway, or better yet, just play someone who does gank better.  If it was truly OK to not gank so much, then not having great ganks wouldn't be a fatal weakness in a jungler, it'd just be a weakness that could be made up for by their other strengths.

We should all just stop playing the jungle, I'm already debating the benefits of running a second tanky initiate support top that occasionally roams over jungling, I'm sick of being told by my teams that i determine the whole games outcome while getting increasingly less tools to do so at a rather rapid pace.
they just need to fix the jungle , at least make it 3 pots instead of 2 and then lower lee sin, vi, and jarvans base stats by a lil.

I am not happy about this (potential) change because it punishes less mobile junglers even more.  Now you have to be within the auto attack range of pretty much every ranged carry in order to cast chilling smite.  Guess what? They will see you coming and they will run.  This change effectively limits the effective junglers even more without addressing the true problems in this seasons jungle.

Mark my words:  If this change goes through to live, expect to see nothing but Jarvan, Lee, and Vi.

Well if you are so upset about this how about you either:

1. Don't play in the jungle or 
2. Play the OP junglers
Cuz the "OP" junglers are boring. I don't want to have to play J4 every match, I want to be able to use the champs I enjoy, like Skarner or Amumu or Nasus in the jungle.
a. You don't have to be in the jungle to be affected by a jungler.

I think it all depends on how much they decrease the range as to weather or not it will actually be a slight nerf to high mobility junglers.  It could be an actual buff to whats already going on.

I mean, on VI I can charge Q, chilling smite, Release Q, and then still have them get away to a tower or whatever because the range on smite is huuuge.

So honestly, if they drop the range even just a bit, it will probably make my Vi ganks stronger just because if I can chilling, I can probably Q and kill.  So in all honestly this nerf to smite range might actually make newer junglers like me who play champs with dashes (Vi, J4, Lee) probably even better and really screw over anyone without a dash or pull.

Which is really dumb.  If the range is shortened too much it just means only Lee, J4, and Vi will be played in *most* games.  Which is boring.  Champions without dashes already have trouble ganking as it is.
